column4: anyone here a crontab expert? I can't seem to get any of my crontabs to run
man crontab.
take a look at the existing ones in /etc/cron.*
I have looked, everything seems fine.
paste the crontab you are trying to get to work.
do you install your crontab using crontab -e ?
if it is a user crontab, you should not specify the user in the crontab.
I do crontab -e
paste your crontab here: http://p.adora.dk
ok. Do this: add this line:  * * * * * date >> /tmp/crontest
did you do that?
then quit editor to install crontab.
the file was made but is empty
I am getting permission denied errors
when quitting editor after crontab -e?
no, it sent mail to my /var/mail/root file
ok. Is /tmp world writable?
it says the script is denied. How can anything be denied to root?
which script?
please use the line I wrote above.
check permissions on your script /opt/scripts/sqlBackup.cron
if it is to be executed, yes.
